docblock.description: Represents the main application page of the work-journal application.
docblock.long-description: This page is meant to serve as the browser's interface to the journalpage controller.

docblock.long-description: PHP Version 5

Abstract Factory for maintaining the MVC relationships. ControllerFactory is the base class of the other controllers. Each controller must have a model, a view, and a helper utility class. The models and views are dynamically created at runtime based on the type of controller. The controller's has 3 roles: 1. Get information from $_POST 2. Decide what course of action to take 3. Tell the browser, model, or view what to do

PHP Version 5
The View represents the part of the MVC that displays the Model to the user. It grabs relevant variables from the Model.
The Model represents all the logic of the application, as well as connections to the persistent data stores.

docblock.description: The constructor dynamically constructs the appropriate views and models as well as the utility object.
All controllers must respond to user actions and perform the approriate operations.
Include the base class of the JournalPageController class.
Include the view of the JournalPageController class.
Include the model of the JournalPageController class.

docblock.long-description: JournalPageController reads the $_POST superglobal, makes decisions on what to do, and delegates tasks to the JournalPageModel and JournalPageView.

docblock.description: Makes decisions based on $_POST variables, and calls class functions to perform the appropriate action.
docblock.long-description: On the journal page, the user can: 1. save their data 2. go to the next day's entry 3. go to the previous day's entry 4. sign out

docblock.description: Go to the next day's entry.
Go to the sign in page.

Include the view of the ReadController class.
Include the model of the ReadController class.

docblock.long-description: ReadController reads the $_POST superglobal, makes decisions on what to do, and delegates tasks to the ReadModel and ReadView.

docblock.description: Makes decisions based on $_POST variables, and calls class functions to perform the appropriate action.
docblock.long-description: On the read page, the user can: 1. sign out 2. go the write page 3. go the templates page 4. read today's entry 5. read all the entries this week 6. read all the entries this month 7. read all the entries this semester

docblock.description: Show all the entries this week.
Show all the entries this month.
Show all the entries this semester.

docblock.description: Include the base class of the ReadModel class.

docblock.long-description: ReadModel takes orders from ReadController, and translates them into actions for the PersistenceLayer. The ReadModel exposes the correct model to the ReadView.
The error message is passed as a reference into the rest of the model, and any errors that occur are proprogated so the WriteView can display it to the user.
The persistence layer handles the database, session, and cookie variables.

docblock.description: Constructs the delegates of the class.

docblock.long-description: Exposes all the entries written today.
Exposes all the entries written this week.
Exposes all the entries written this month.
Exposes all the entries written this semester.
Gets the exposed entries from the model.
Gets the current error message from the model.
Sets the current error message depending on what the error is.

docblock.description: Include the base class of the WriteModel class.
Include the input validator for the WriteModel class.

docblock.long-description: WriteModel takes orders from WriteController, and translates them into actions for the PersistenceLayer. The WriteModel exposes the correct model to the WriteView. It also acts as a gatekeeper for input passed on from the WriteController.
The error message is passed as a reference into the rest of the model, and any errors that occur are proprogated so the WriteView can display it to the user.
The input validator filters input acquired from the controller. They also pass error messages to the model.
The persistence layer handles the database, session, and cookie variables.

docblock.description: Constructs the delegates of the class.

docblock.long-description: Creates a blank entry with headers corresponding to the selected template. Set it as the working entry.
Saves the current entry into the database.
Deletes the current entry from the database. A blank entry becomes the working entry.
Erases all the responses in current entry. Makes no changes to the database.
Shows a blank entry with one empty header and one empty response.
Goes to the entries of the next day. Discards the working entry.
Goes to the entries of the previous day. Discards the working entry.
Retrieve the date that the user wants to go to.
Get the names of the templates that exist.
Gets the current error message from the model.
Sets the current error message depending on what the error is.
